page.title: 18St Juthware
page.content: A small new housing development along the Yeovil road in Halstock is called St Juthware's Close - and the pub is The Quiet Woman, the sign showing a headless lady serenely carrying her head under her arm. Enquiries produced this story: The name Halstock signifies Holy Place and there used to be a shrine here which attracted pilgrims. In the 7th century, a young woman called Juthware living up towards Abbots Hill, befriended these travellers to the annoyance of her stepmother and half brother. The latter eventually became so incensed that he cut off her head with his sword. He was dismayed when she picked up the head, walked down to the village, and laid it on the alter in the church, before lying down to die. Her ghost is said to re-enact this on the anniversary of her death.
